到達目標: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following
授業方法:
If you need to contact me, please do so at andrew.kgu@gmail.com
Most classes will involve a lecture component followed by whole-class and small-group discussions. Groups will sometimes be asked to make impromptu speeches to summarize the contents of discussion. The final few classes of the semester will be dedicated to student presentations. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments. The course could involve LIVE online sessions with students from aborad.

第1回:
**The course contents are subject to change, depending on whether a suitable partner university can be found. A needs analyses will be done during the first class of the semester.
Icebreakers: Students get to know each other and learn about the course, and possibly the background of overseas partner students

In principle, all 14 sessions will be conducted face to face
Needs analysis survey: 1 hour
self-intro video: 1 hour
第2回: View overseas student self-intros; make comments; prepare COIL activity #2 (a day in my life)
Make comments and complete "a day in my life" video: 2-3 hours
第3回: Synchronous Zoom class with overseas students (COIL activity #3), discussing “a day in the life” videos
Prepare for first LIVE Zoom: 1 hour
第4回: Written reflection and small-team discussions about COIL. Introduce the Autobiography of Intercultural Encounters (AIE)
第5回: Final COIL activities #4 and #5: short video on team-chosen cultural topic and synchronous Zoom class with overseas students
Final cultural-content video and second Zoom preparation: 3-4 hours
第6回: Reflections on identity development through COIL; Who am I?
第7回: AIE section 1; discussion on stereotypes, prejudice, and discrimination
第8回: AIE sections 2 and 3; discussion on empathy
第9回: AIE sections 4 and 5; discussion on nonverbal communication
第11回: AIE sections 6 and 7; deep culture podcast “Beyond the dos and don'ts”
第12回: AIE sections 8 and 9; discussion on cross-cultural etiquette
第13回: Prepare and deliver final presentation: 10-15 hours (approximately)
